sub_title: Assistant Professor at Technische Universiteit Delft

education.field_of_study: Systems Engineering, Policy Analysis and Management

projects.title: Exploratory Modeling Workbench
projects.description: Exploratory Modeling and Analysis (EMA) is a research methodology that uses computational experiments to analyze complex and uncertain systems. The EMA workbench is aimed at providing support for doing EMA on models developed in various modelling packages and environments. Currently, we focus on offering support for doing EMA on models developed in Vensim, Excel, and Python. Future plans include support for Netlogo and Repast. The EMA workbench offers support for designing experiments, performing the experiments - including support for parallel processing-, and analysing the results. A key design principle is that people should be able to perform EMA on normal computers, instead of having to take recourse to a HPC.

contributors.headline: Assistant Professor at Technische Universiteit Delft
Professor of Decision Making under Deep Uncertainty at TU Delft

projects.title: The Geopolitics of Shale Gas
projects.description:
This in-depth study on the geopolitical implications of the US shale gas revolution was conducted by HCSS in the context of the TNO ‘Strategy & Change program’.

Using advanced computer modeling techniques the study analyzed the geopolitical impact of the US' shale gas revolution on traditional hydrocarbon exporting countries in the EU neighbourhood. 

The study concludes that the surge in US' shale gas (and increasingly shale oil) production could in the long term destabilize traditional oil- and gas exporters in the EU neighbourhood. A combination of substitution effects and greater energy efficiency, could put pressure on the price of oil, leading to fiscal difficulties in traditional hydrocarbon exporting countries. HCSS calls upon the EU to seek alternate interdependencies with the oil and gas exporters in its immediate neighborhood, leading to a further development of these nations.

profile_positions.description: Part of the Policy Analysis Section of the Faculty of Technology, Policy and Management. I lecture courses on System Dynamics and Decision Making under Deep Uncertainty for TPM's bachelor and master students. My research focuses on the impact of deep uncertainty on model development.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description: Part of the Policy Analysis Section of the Faculty of Technology, Policy and Management. I lecture courses on System Dynamics and Decision Making under Deep Uncertainty for TPM's bachelor and master students. My research focuses on exploring the consequences of uncertainty in large and complex societal issues, like resource scarcity, state stability, and societal ageing.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer and researcher

profile_positions.description: Writing scientific articles on methodological approaches (System Dynamics, Scenario Discovery, and Robust Decision Making) used in HCSS' projects. Focus lies on the consequences of uncertainty for policy making in complex systems, like large societal issues.
profile_positions.title: PhD candidate
